meanings.definition: Move or cause to move in a twisting or turning motion.
meanings.sent1: The caterpillar was trindling along the branch.
meanings.sent2: She trindled the ribbon around the gift box.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy was trindling in circles chasing its tail.
meanings.sent4: The trindling river snaked its way through the valley.
meanings.sent5: The dancer's graceful movements resembled trindling leaves in the wind.

meanings.definition: To roll or tumble in a jerky manner.
meanings.sent1: The ball trindled down the hill.
meanings.sent2: He accidentally trindled off the edge of the bed.
meanings.sent3: The trindling stones made a clattering noise as they rolled down the slope.
meanings.sent4: The trindling dice determined the fate of the game.
meanings.sent5: The trindling tumbleweed bounced unpredictably in the desert breeze.
